intro: Couepia bracteosa f. typica, commonly known as the typical bracteosa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated by insects, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
